meanings.definition: A person who gives orders or instructions.
meanings.sent1: The commander was a strict commenders in the army.
meanings.sent2: The commenders of the team directed everyone to their positions.
meanings.sent3: The commenders at the restaurant told the chef to add extra cheese to the pizza.
meanings.sent4: As the commenders of the ship, they steered through the storm with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The commenders of the meeting ensured that everyone followed the agenda.

meanings.definition: A person who entrusts something to another.
meanings.sent1: The commenders handed over the key to the safe to the trusted employee.
meanings.sent2: She acted as the commenders of the family heirlooms, passing them down to the next generation.
meanings.sent3: The commenders of the secret recipe shared it with the new chef.
meanings.sent4: The commenders of the mission entrusted the crucial information to the agent.
meanings.sent5: Being the commenders of the project, they delegated tasks efficiently.

meanings.definition: A group of people who have authority or control.
meanings.sent1: The board of directors served as the commenders of the company.
meanings.sent2: The commenders of the organization made important decisions together.
meanings.sent3: The commenders of the school decided to implement a new policy.
meanings.sent4: The commenders of the council led the community with wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The commenders of the team motivated everyone to achieve success.
